file_content.text: Anything the Diplomatic Service can do to assist you, say the word.
I don't think he's getting up. Kolto injections can't restore a dead man.
Yes! Very good. You should be proud to have saved us from that monster....
Don't you dare talk! You brought him here, you tried to get me killed!
Godoba. What do you have to say?
Is that true?
What else would you expect from a Hutt?
Hardly a surprise.
Good for him.
It was not only me! The Shadow Syndicate agreed! Vaarko wanted it most of all.
Maybe. But you made the call to Ukabi.
Only after you made him our enemy! You cut our profits in half! This is business.
The Empire has been a good partner to us. But this woman--she is incompetent, interfering. You have seen this.
Defy "this woman" and you defy the greatest power in the galaxy.
She represents the Empire.
"This woman" is my client. I'm here to do a job.
She's paying my bill.
Yes, of course--bounty hunter's honor. But there is no dishonor in accepting a better contract.
I think I've had enough.
True enough.
Shut up, Hutt.
No! All we want is our flexibility. She dies, and we will be happy. The Empire will be happy we are happy!
How dare you?
Kill her. Let business proceed, let a smarter girl take her place--and the Shadow Syndicate will reward you. Our wealth and power... yours!
Your "wealth and power" are worthless.
My loyalty isn't for sale.
I'd like him alive, if you would. He's a powerful creature, and he may still serve a purpose.
Yes. Yes, I--ah!
Besides--I'd like to hold him as an example before the Shadow Syndicate.
And you, my lord. I am eternally grateful for your aid. This business has taken far too much of your time.
And you--I am deeply grateful for your aid. I know you must have other business on this world.
Ukabi will not be my last victim here.
Other battles await.
If I told you why I was here, the nightmares would never end.
You can't imagine.
The Exchange had to be removed--but there are other enemies here.
My mission never ends.
These days, business follows me.
You have no idea.
Now that Ukabi and the Shadow Syndicate are dealt with--what next?
What will happen now?
The war against the Exchange will continue, but our focus can move to other enemies.
Another mistake, and your life is forfeit.
Do not fail again.
Yes, my lord. I understand.
I saved your life, but that doesn't mean you're suited for this job. Go back to Dromund Kaas.
You're a failure.
I'll--I'll take that under advisement. Of course.
Thank you again for your assistance. And when Nar Shaddaa finally falls to the Empire... we'll remember the role you played.
The Shadow Syndicate is in my debt. Don't forget it.
I accept your offer.
Why...?
Excellent! The Syndicate should convene. Come!
...I promise, the unfortunate loss of Maro Vizhen will not inhibit our alliance with the Empire.
The DX annihilator network will supply data on Exchange activities. They will reassemble.
We'll work to crush them and all the Empire's enemies on Nar Shaddaa. Our promise.
This whole moon will be under our control.
Everything will belong to us.
That is the dream.
Crush anyone you want. Just don't count on my help.
Keep me out of politics.
Glad to have assisted.
Don't think of betraying me.
Noted.
We will keep you no longer. Enjoy our city--it has much to experience, and much to offer....
Stop him. You have to stop him....
My lord? Are you there, my lord? It's Maro Vizhen.
Is anybody there? This is Maro Vizhen--please respond.
I'm here. The inner circle of the Exchange is dead, but their leader is missing.
I can't find Ukabi.
That's because he's here. Ukabi is here!
Receiving your signal.
You know better than to interrupt me.
I don't have time for this.
This is an emergency. The Exchange is attacking! Ukabi is here!
Someone sold us out. Get back as soon as you can, we can't hold them--
Time to strike the final blow. Good luck in the Exchange base.
Our guards captured a few of the gangsters. The Exchange is based in the tunnels running under this sector.
Maybe now's the time to push. Wipe them out, their leaders along with Ukabi.
The DX annihilator network approves.
Perhaps... I think I speak on behalf of the Shadow Syndicate when I ask, with due respect: Can this be done?
I am not easily destroyed.
It can be done.
Do not underestimate the power that flows through me, slaver.
The Force makes it possible.
No. Certainly not.
Suicide missions have always been my specialty.
It can be done.
All I need is a target.
I'll get the job done.
Your "Syndicate" is comprised of the most powerful people on Nar Shaddaa. Your lives are worth a lot.
The price will be high.
Very well. Extort your price for protection; we have little choice but to pay.
I should leave you to the Exchange's mercy.
You deserve this fate.
You will not, though. Our fates are tied together!
You'll have to take out the members of Ukabi's inner circle--all of them are cybernetically enhanced.
Custom-built masterworks, equal to a dozen Mandalorian warriors.
When they're dead, proceed to Ukabi's chambers. Do... whatever you have to do.
You have made an unforgivable mistake.
This is not necessary, Ukabi. We should not be enemies!
You began this conflict. All our businesses suffer. Now you all die.
Ukabi. I've been waiting to meet you a long time.
You must be the Exchange boss.
Someone explain this.
Meet the face of our enemy.
That's big talk from a terrified little gangster.
You pathetic fool.
The attackers.
The attacker.
You eliminated my death squads, but my facilities create supreme soldiers with every passing minute.
You have weakened my forces, but my death squads wade through blood as we speak.
I will make masks of your skulls before dawn.
I have killed your kind before, Sith. I will again.
Your head will be my trophy before dawn.
You! Imperial diplomat--this is your fault!
It looks bad, I know, but I've been working on a strategy.
No more games. One way or another, this must end.
We need to finish this.
Strategy?
Leave the strategizing to people who know better.
I'm getting tired of you.
Let her speak. If she fails us again, she knows she'll pay the price.
If you attack Ukabi's army at its source, maybe we can settle this.
You won't have long to intercept those death squads and stop their ships from launching.
My informants tell me that Ukabi is preparing for war--against the Empire and all its allies!
He is preparing an army of stim-enhanced killers and cybernetically linked assassins.
Detonite droid production has increased.
Ah--very well. If Ukabi won't learn his lesson, then the Empire can handle his dying blows.
Ukabi wants a fight. I welcome it.
Finally, a challenge.
Who knew you could have so much fun playing with criminals?
The game's afoot.
We'll have to move fast. Determine our assets and vulnerabilities.
Let's get to work.
I can stay on the job, but the fee goes up.
Guess you still need me, then.
All right. You'll get your money.
Quiet. You've caused plenty of trouble already.
That's enough out of you.
Don't involve me in this.
Ha! You think so? Ukabi knows you now. He will find you, chase you! You are involved already.
My sources report Exchange death squads on the move. As you destroyed his assets, he'll destroy ours--the Promenade, factories, slave pens.
Death squads in the casinos. Slaughtering customers, massacring my slaves!
Ukabi is drawing energy for his chemical enhancement facilities. He augments soldiers for battle; he must be stopped now.
I'm not a strategist! Your recommendation, my lord?
I don't--I don't--what do you suggest we do?
Let the Exchange target civilians while we carve out their heart. These enhancement facilities--what are they?
Let's go on the offensive.
Ukabi uses kolto tanks, medical equipment, to pump his elite full of adrenals.
You'll have to destroy the tanks and face their creations.
We can't let Exchange death squads roam freely. How do we intercept them?
We need to protect the city.
The Exchange has a private landing pad. Intercept the death squads, destroy their ships, and maybe....
I'll alert our forces here and keep the Shadow Syndicate in line. We can discuss this when you return.
If they survive....
If she survives....
If he survives....
You are bold, calling us now. I do not like bold.
Godoba, please. I have good news.
Do not attempt to dissimulate!
No dissimulation intended. But I wanted you to meet someone.
My friends, allow me to introduce the Diplomatic Service's allies on Nar Shaddaa--the Shadow Syndicate.
My lord, allow me to introduce the Diplomatic Service's allies on Nar Shaddaa--the Shadow Syndicate.
These creatures--their loyalty is to the Empire?
They serve us?
Their loyalty is to our alliance.
So this is who the Empire's been cavorting with.
Interesting.
Welcome. Allow me to introduce the Diplomatic Service's allies on Nar Shaddaa--the Shadow Syndicate.
I'm glad to see the Hutt clans are falling in line.
This reminds me of Hutta...
Quite. After Nem'ro joined us, others began to follow.
I worked with scum like this on Hutta.
I know their kind.
Scum like the Nem'ro clan, I hear.
Who are these people?
What's going on?
I'll show you around the room.
I don't need to meet the locals. Get rid of them.
Our business is private.
This won't take long. They need to know what you did.
Godoba the Hutt, owner of the Club Vertica Casino and five city sectors. Your ship is docked in his spaceport.
Yes. And you are standing in my building.
Vaarko Tiyai, Cho'mash of the Nar Shaddaa Labor Alliance. There are no better slavers in the galaxy.
A pleasure.
And last, DX-TX, Primary Hub of the DX annihilator network.
Your destructive prowess is respectable. Negotiations permitted.
Together, they represent key powers. Ukabi and the Exchange could've joined them--but thanks to your strike, we needn't worry about the Exchange anymore.
The Corellian Sector is in flames. The Exchange won't be rebuilding.
I did what you asked.
With all due respect to you and your talents... that may not be so. This woman has lied to you.
Some insects keep crawling after being stomped.
Are you sure?
You may be more right than you know. This woman has lied to you.
Too bad I still feel like killing.
But I'm still bloodthirsty.
Then you, of all of us, may be in luck. This woman has lied to you.
What?
Does she even know what she has done?
Your strike may have crippled the Exchange's business operations, but every time a fool attacks Ukabi's holdings, devastation follows... and Ukabi expands his territory.
She has blundered where many upstarts blundered before. And now we all pay the price.
What makes Ukabi so great a threat?
Explain yourself.
Don't be a coward.
Vaarko, really. We're hardly vulnerable.
I should've killed you instead of the Exchange.
She's incompetent.
I'm sure they're exaggerating the situation. They....
We should talk, but now isn't the time.
A pleasure, my lord.
You pathetic fool.
You pathetic fool.
We need to finish this.
We need to finish this.
I'm getting tired of you.
I'm getting tired of you.
It can be done.
It can be done.
The Force makes it possible.
The Force makes it possible.
It can be done.
It can be done.
I'll get the job done.
I'll get the job done.
The price will be high.
The price will be high.
